title: Oman looking for tourist boost with new airport and varied accommodation
text:
Oman looking for tourist boost with new airport and varied accommodation 17 August 2015 Save 
Oman is hoping the opening of a new airport in Salalah and a wider range of accommodation will boost visitor numbers. 
Asma Al Hajry, the deputy director general international tourism for Oman’s ministry of tourism, said 130,000 Brits visited the sultanate in 2014, a 4% increase year on year and making it Europe’s largest market. 
She believes numbers will be further boosted as the new amenities offer a wider range of choice to potential travellers. 
The new international airport in Salalah opened this summer and has the capacity to handle one million passengers a year. 
She said: “It is an additional airport that’s (being built) because there is a huge demand in the region. It attracts a lot of tourists. 
“We’re looking at growing the market more aggressively and I think there’s a huge potential as well from the UK taking into account the relationship we have.” 
Al Hajry added plans were also afoot to widen the range of accommodation in order to attract more than the luxury market to Oman. 
She said: “We do have five star and four-star (accommodation) but … the government has to expand that. We do have a number of projects in the pipeline to increase the potential.” 
Al Hajry added Oman is also using its growing reputation as a competitive sailing nation to also drive tourist numbers. 
She said tour operators were invited to join employees from both the Oman Ministry of Tourism, Oman Air and Oman Sail at Cowes Week to experience the sultanate’s MOD70 Musandam sailing yacht. 
Representatives from Neilsons, Audley Travel and Turquoise Holidays all partook, as well as a schools operator Travelbound.
